ingressRules.description: Ingress rules to use in security group for AWS VPC provisioning
ingressRules.title: Security Group Rules

iap.description: Adapter instances to use while running automation in IAP
iap.title: IAP

globalProtectEnabled.description: Indicates if global protect feature should be supported or not for the given PAN service. For global protect to work bundle must be set to 'VM_SERIES_BUNDLE_2'
globalProtectEnabled.title: Global Protect Enabled

panoramaEnabled.description: This should be set to true if Panorama is enabled
panoramaEnabled.title: Panorama Enabled

items.helper: Use CIDR block notation, i.e. 10.20.30.1/28
items.title: VPC Subnet

items.description: Ingress rules to use in security group for AWS VPC provisioning

items.placeholder: Enter a source subnet CIDR mask
items.title: Source Subnet CIDR Mask
Security Group Rules

items.helper: See possible instance types at https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/instance-types.html
items.title: Instance Type

items.helper: The name of the key pair. If you do not specify a key pair, you can't connect to the instance unless you choose an AMI that is configured to allow users another way to log in.
items.title: Key Name

items.helper: Note the customer name provided is used to construct names of AWS VPC, security group, and security group description as well as Alkira AWS and internet connectors.
items.title: Customer Name

items.helper: Provide tenant network Id for cloud application
items.placeholder: Enter tenant network Id to use
items.title: Tenant Network Id

items.helper: Group for internet connector created in Alkira
items.title: Internet Connector Group

items.helper: The type of algorithm to be used for traffic distribution
items.title: Internet Connector Algorithm

items.helper: The name of the Alkira Cloud Exchange (CXP) region. A network is usually associated with one or more CXPs. A connector/service can be placed on any CXP that is associated with the network.
items.title: CXP Region

items.helper: Group to use for AWS VPC connector created in Alkira
items.placeholder: Select group for AWS VPC connector
items.title: AWS VPC Connector Group

items.helper: Size of the AWS VPC connector
items.title: AWS VPC Connector Size

items.helper: An opaque identifier which is generated when storing PAN credentials. See https://itential.portal.alkira.com/doc/api.html#operation/addPANCredentialsUsingPOST
items.title: Credential ID

items.helper: Supported tunnel protocol types. For Azure regions, only IPSEC is supported.
items.title: Tunnel Protocol

items.helper: The pin value of the PAN Registration that is required for automated deployments to securely access the device certificate and other Palo Alto cloud-delivered services.
items.title: Registration PIN

items.helper: The pin id of the PAN Registration that is required for automated deployments to securely access the device certificate and other Palo Alto cloud-delivered services.
items.title: Registration PIN ID

items.helper: Expiration date of the provisioned Palo Alto Firewall instance(s)
items.title: Expiration Date

items.helper: Username to connect to provisioned Palo Alto Firewall
items.title: Username

items.helper: Password to use for provisioned Palo Alto Firewall
items.title: Password

items.helper: The maximum number of PAN instances that should be deployed when auto-scale is enabled. A maximum of 8 can be deployed.
items.title: Max Instance Count

items.helper: The minimum number of PAN instances that should be deployed at any point of time. In case Global Protect is enabled, min instance count should be same as max instance count as the auto-scale is not supported with Global Protect enabled
items.title: Min Instance Count

items.helper:
In case a user wants to use their own PAN VM-Series Firewall license, they can choose the Bring-Your-Own-License (BYOL) licensing option.

For the Pay-As-You-Go (PAYG) option, specify the VM Bundle, Firewall Version, and Size.

Bundle 1 provides a threat Prevention (IDS/IPS) subscription and Premium Support.

Bundle 2 provides additional support for URL Filtering, WildFire, GlobalProtect, and DNS Security subscriptions.
items.title: License Type

items.description: Indicates if global protect feature should be supported or not for the given PAN service. For global protect to work bundle must be set to 'VM_SERIES_BUNDLE_2'
items.title: Global Protect Enabled

items.description: This should be set to true if Panorama is enabled
items.title: Panorama Enabled

items.helper: This indicates the software image bundle that would be used for PAN instance deployment. This is applicable for licenseType 'PAY_AS_YOU_GO' only. If not provided default PAN_VM_300_BUNDLE_2 would be used. However PAN_VM_300_BUNDLE_2 is legacy bundle and is no more supported on AWS. It is recommended to use VM_SERIES_BUNDLE_1 and VM_SERIES_BUNDLE_2 (supports Global Protect)
items.title: Bundle

items.helper: The size of the Palo Alto Firewall service to provision
items.placeholder: Select a Palo Alto Firewall service size
items.title: Palo Alto Firewall Service Size

items.helper: The version of Palo Alto Firewall that should be deployed
items.title: Version

items.helper: Id of the segment to be used in segment options for the provisioned Palo Alto Firewall service. Note segment must be associated with tenant network Id chosen for this automation
items.title: Segment

items.helper: Select group(s) for Prod AWS Zone. Used in segment options for the segment inputted for the PAN FW service in Alkira.
items.placeholder: Select group(s) for Prod AWS Zone
items.title: Prod AWS Zone

items.helper: Select group(s) for On Prem Zone. Used in segment options for the segment inputted for the PAN FW service in Alkira.
items.placeholder: Select group(s) for On Prem Zone
items.title: On Prem Zone

items.helper: Select group(s) for INET Zone. Used in segment options for the segment inputted for the PAN FW service in Alkira.
items.title: INET Zone

items.helper: Select group(s) for Prod Azure Zone. Used in segment options for the segment inputted for the PAN FW service in Alkira.
items.placeholder: Select group(s) for Prod Azure Zone
items.title: Prod Azure Zone

items.description: Adapter instances to use while running automation in IAP

items.helper: Select an adapter to use to connect to AWS EC2
items.title: AWS EC2 Adapter

items.helper: Select an adapter to use to connect to Itential Automation Gateway
items.title: Automation Gateway Adapter

items.helper: Select an adapter to use to connect to Alkira
items.title: Alkira Adapter
IAP

awsVpcConnectorGroup.ui:help: Group to use for AWS VPC connector created in Alkira
awsVpcConnectorGroup.ui:placeholder: Select group for AWS VPC connector

awsVpcConnectorSize.ui:help: Size of the AWS VPC connector

customerName.ui:help: Note the customer name provided is used to construct names of AWS VPC, security group, and security group description as well as Alkira AWS and internet connectors.

cxpRegion.ui:help: The name of the Alkira Cloud Exchange (CXP) region. A network is usually associated with one or more CXPs. A connector/service can be placed on any CXP that is associated with the network.

internetConnectorAlgorithm.ui:help: The type of algorithm to be used for traffic distribution

internetConnectorGroup.ui:help: Group for internet connector created in Alkira

tenantNetworkId.ui:help: Provide tenant network Id for cloud application
tenantNetworkId.ui:placeholder: Enter tenant network Id to use

sourceSubnetCidrMask.ui:placeholder: Enter a source subnet CIDR mask

keyName.ui:help: The name of the key pair. If you do not specify a key pair, you can't connect to the instance unless you choose an AMI that is configured to allow users another way to log in.

alkiraAdapter.ui:help: Select an adapter to use to connect to Alkira

automationGatewayAdapter.ui:help: Select an adapter to use to connect to Itential Automation Gateway

awsEc2Adapter.ui:help: Select an adapter to use to connect to AWS EC2

bundle.ui:help: This indicates the software image bundle that would be used for PAN instance deployment. This is applicable for licenseType 'PAY_AS_YOU_GO' only. If not provided default PAN_VM_300_BUNDLE_2 would be used. However PAN_VM_300_BUNDLE_2 is legacy bundle and is no more supported on AWS. It is recommended to use VM_SERIES_BUNDLE_1 and VM_SERIES_BUNDLE_2 (supports Global Protect)

credentialId.ui:help: An opaque identifier which is generated when storing PAN credentials. See https://itential.portal.alkira.com/doc/api.html#operation/addPANCredentialsUsingPOST

expirationDate.ui:help: Expiration date of the provisioned Palo Alto Firewall instance(s)

inetZone.ui:help: Select group(s) for INET Zone. Used in segment options for the segment inputted for the PAN FW service in Alkira.

licenseType.ui:help:
In case a user wants to use their own PAN VM-Series Firewall license, they can choose the Bring-Your-Own-License (BYOL) licensing option.

For the Pay-As-You-Go (PAYG) option, specify the VM Bundle, Firewall Version, and Size.

Bundle 1 provides a threat Prevention (IDS/IPS) subscription and Premium Support.

Bundle 2 provides additional support for URL Filtering, WildFire, GlobalProtect, and DNS Security subscriptions.

maxInstanceCount.ui:help: The maximum number of PAN instances that should be deployed when auto-scale is enabled. A maximum of 8 can be deployed.

minInstanceCount.ui:help: The minimum number of PAN instances that should be deployed at any point of time. In case Global Protect is enabled, min instance count should be same as max instance count as the auto-scale is not supported with Global Protect enabled

onPremZone.ui:help: Select group(s) for On Prem Zone. Used in segment options for the segment inputted for the PAN FW service in Alkira.
onPremZone.ui:placeholder: Select group(s) for On Prem Zone

paloAltoFirewallServiceSize.ui:help: The size of the Palo Alto Firewall service to provision
paloAltoFirewallServiceSize.ui:placeholder: Select a Palo Alto Firewall service size

password.ui:help: Password to use for provisioned Palo Alto Firewall

prodAwsZone.ui:help: Select group(s) for Prod AWS Zone. Used in segment options for the segment inputted for the PAN FW service in Alkira.
prodAwsZone.ui:placeholder: Select group(s) for Prod AWS Zone

prodAzureZone.ui:help: Select group(s) for Prod Azure Zone. Used in segment options for the segment inputted for the PAN FW service in Alkira.
prodAzureZone.ui:placeholder: Select group(s) for Prod Azure Zone

registrationPin.ui:help: The pin value of the PAN Registration that is required for automated deployments to securely access the device certificate and other Palo Alto cloud-delivered services.

registrationPinId.ui:help: The pin id of the PAN Registration that is required for automated deployments to securely access the device certificate and other Palo Alto cloud-delivered services.

segment.ui:help: Id of the segment to be used in segment options for the provisioned Palo Alto Firewall service. Note segment must be associated with tenant network Id chosen for this automation

tunnelProtocol.ui:help: Supported tunnel protocol types. For Azure regions, only IPSEC is supported.

username.ui:help: Username to connect to provisioned Palo Alto Firewall

version.ui:help: The version of Palo Alto Firewall that should be deployed
